content: Removed constraint "16 lines of 16 symbols". It is just repeating what has been stated in Input section and is redundant.
Edited to fix the "Zzzzz..." test & associated validator (see https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-a-mountain-of-a-mole-hill/185085/7).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well put, interesting puzzle...
Level description is also fair. Is probably too tough for a CoC

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is more complex than I originally thought, not really 'easy' category in my book, and no way it is a CoC.
At first, I also though of floodFill as cyberLemonade wrote, however the matryoshka style gardens in the last few test cases make it more difficult, especially if area is full of holes, without any dot or space.
In the end, I solved it without floodFill, but it took some time to debug all the edge cases...
Nice puzzle, BTW.
This would make a great CoC IMHO. Implementing a floodfill/BFS shouldn't be hard in 15 minutes, and the problem is interesting enough. Not sure if it's tough enough for a classic puzzle though.

That could be very interesting for a CoC in the three categories (maybe whitout many exception in different form?).
For a reverse problem particularly, that could be fun !

clearly not medium. 
Should be a nice CoC maybe. 
Or a simple not more

A question for natives or fluent speakers around here : I'm in trouble with this "other space" formulation. I don't know how to call it. Open space sounds a bit corporate an outer space too... interstellar. Any idea of a clear way to name the non-garden space ? Thank you.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is not a that har problem, but i think the difficulty must be Medium, i'll fix it but you have from me a approve :)

Hi.

This (maybe not so) easy game started out as an idea for CoC but got tricky.
There are some simple solutions, but many bad ones as well.

Hi, IAmNoob.

A general thank you for all your feedback on my contributions today. You made my day.

I see that the difficulty has been updated to Medium.

Thank you.
Ok. I set it back to Easy.

Hi, Yukiko.
Thanks for your feedback.
I'm not sure what you mean by "maybe whitout many exception in different form?"
If you mean removing the tricky cases, well... that would be a pity. I think that here, the whole point is that it looks simple (split on the pipes ? regex ? Use whitespaces and dots ...?) until you realize their can't be a solution considering only one line at a time.

If I keep only the two first cases, then it is trivial. In fact, it started as a CoC but I soon realized everything I thought about that problem was wrong. Afterward, the solution might seem obvious when looking at all the test cases (I can't tell) but I'm pretty sure many people will go for a line by line solution before realizing it is impossible. And that is for me the main (if not only) point of this puzzle. That seems a bit harsh to expect in 5 minutes, but for a simple puzzle, I think it has a nice twist.

Hi, CyberLemonade.
Did you solve it with a floodfill or a BFS ?

Thank you. That is exactly what I thought. When people say it is too easy, I wonder if they tried. The solution is simple but not obvious and there are many wrong ways to go. Floodfill is hardly an option.

I have prepared a couple of other test cases I might add. I have one where the very same line twice gives 2 different results.
Not exactly, just swept across every row, and whenever I encountered a hill, checked if I was inside my garden (with a boolean). Just needed to tweak a few edge cases.

Hello, 
I think i misspoke a little. Your puzzle is very good with all these tricky form.
It is perfect for a puzzle.

But,in addition to this puzzle, that could be interesting to create a CoC with the same topic but whitout too many tricky cases (because in CoC, in 15 min that could be hard if you let tricky form)
